column4: friends, need my komodo edit work on 10.04, any help, running "komodo" on terminal gives nothing....
how to uninstall komodo which was installed using ./install.sh ?
Please make sure that you're following all the install instructions, especially step 7: http://docs.activestate.com/komodo/4.4/install.html#Installing_Komodo_on_Linux
thanks, but i have done all those steps, still its not working, just thought of unistalling it and reinstalling it. I am unable to find the libraries./ dependencies they specified there... :(
Those prequesiites should already be installed.
yeah, but i should atleast find that in synaptic manager rite?
yes, but keep in mind that package names are not always standard.
ok, then now how will i know all dependencies are installed, especially when it's not working :-/
can you make something out of this "Komodo-Edit-6/bin/../lib/mozilla/komodo-bin: error while loading shared libraries: libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
dia? Or do you mean to actually create the database itself?
nop, i just need a schema designer....
dia might be able to do that.
How about you just state what your question is.
nothing, can't explain as a simple sentence :)
great. so my applications remain untouched ?
